item.description: Gautam Rao | Homepage Gautam Rao Assistant Professor of Economics, Harvard University Bio Contact Publications Working Papers Work in Progress From Another Life Personal Media Coverage This is a note for Harvard PhD students who would like me to advise their reseach. Importantly, none of the following is set in stone. Different types of advising relationships work best for different students. If you would like me to be your advisor, come talk to me, and we can discuss what would work best for you.

I’m an Assistant Professor at the University of California, Davis, Department of Economics. I’m also a Lemann Fellow, a Faculty Affiliate at the Center for Effective Global Action CEGA and an Invited Researcher for JPAL . My current research focus is in the field of Development Economics, in particular, its intersection with Public, Political and Organizational Economics. As a researcher, Iâ€™m interested in two topics, poor governance in governments and social mobility, both of which I study in the developing country context.
Email: dsmoreira@ucdavis.edu Tel: +1 (530) 754-1553 Address: Department of Economics 1140 SSH building, University of California, Davis Davis, CA 95616 U.S.A.

Media Coverage “How Research Affects Policy: Experimental Evidence from 2,150 Brazilian Municipalities” Audio and Video: [VoxDev] In print: [NPR - Planet Money] [LiveMint] [El Comercio] [Folha de Sao Paulo] [Nexo Jornal] [Folha de Sao Paulo] “Success Spills Over: How Awards Affect Winners and Peers Performance in Brazil” Audio and Video: [UChicago - Social Interaction and Education Conference] In print: [O Globo] “Political Turnover, Bureaucratic Turnover and The Quality of Public Services” In print: [O Globo]
Teaching ECN 290: Development As Effective Governments ECN 102: Analysis of Economic Data Office Hours If you are a current student, please check the syllabus for updated OH or by appointment.
